article_title: States Fail To Make Health Care Prices Transparent To Consumers

article_metadata.description: Forty-five of 50 states – 90 percent – fail to adequately make price information available to their consumers even as the Affordable Care Act, employers and insurance companies push for greater transparency, according to a new analysis. In their “Report Card on State Price Transparency Laws,” the nonprofit Health Care Incentives [...]
article_metadata.author: Bruce Japsen
